instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
small water damage at screen connector on the screen side(not get to the mac logic board).
working fine with external screen, replaced screen with good know but the same.
replaced <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> still same...no display no backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
Something else damaged by liquid.

The affected connector has direct connections with MLB.
Do not think that liquid didn't affect MLB.
A spike from backlight output to a data line, went back to MLB, of course.

Sometime only <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> gets bad, but not always; is question of luck.
Be sure <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> is properly soldered and surrounding components in place.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 70788, member: 682"]
<CHIP>U9850</CHIP> is properly soldered and surrounding components in place.
[/QUOTE]
did it 2 times all look good...where else can i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW</SIGNAL> at J8500?
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high?
Change <CHIP>U5210</CHIP>, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71871, member: 682"]
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high?
[/QUOTE]
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should be high just with lcd connecting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> can only go high if LCD is connected.
If stays low, PCH cannot detect LCD presence; internal eDP output is then disabled.
You have a problem with LCD assembly, J8500, or video flex.
